metadata.feature_description: Display comprehensive user activity metrics including rank, reputation, experience, engagement, influence, and contribution statistics

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View activity details for regular user with activities

steps.action: Navigate to Admin > Users section via Manage menu
steps.expected: Users list displays with authorized users
steps.actual: Users list displayed showing 15 authorized users with action icons including User Activity

steps.action: Click on User Activity icon for Test User12
steps.expected: User Activity details panel expands showing activity metrics
steps.actual: Activity details panel expanded showing: Last Active: 37 minutes ago, Rank: 3, Reputation: 6, Experience: 6, Engagement: 0, Influence: 0, Total Contributions: 0, Recent Activity: 'Joined Site 2 weeks ago'

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify all metrics display correctly (rank, reputation, experience)

steps.action: Click on User Activity icon for Test User05
steps.expected: Activity panel displays all metrics: Rank, Reputation, Experience
steps.actual: Activity panel displays: Rank: 5, Reputation: 5, Experience: 5 - all metrics correctly displayed with numeric values

steps.action: View engagement metric in User Activity panel for Test User05
steps.expected: Engagement displays as percentage with progress bar
steps.actual: Engagement displays with value '0' and a progress bar showing 0% fill

steps.action: View influence metric in User Activity panel for Test User05
steps.expected: Influence displays as percentage with progress bar
steps.actual: Influence displays with value '0' and a progress bar showing 0% fill

steps.action: View total contributions in User Activity panel
steps.actual: Total contributions displays as '0 TOTAL CONTRIBUTIONS' with proper formatting

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify last active date formatting (relative time)

steps.action: View Last Active field in User Activity panel
steps.expected: Last Active displays in relative time format (e.g., '2 weeks ago')
steps.actual: Last Active displays as '2 weeks ago' for Test User05 and '37 minutes ago' for Test User12 - relative time formatting working correctly

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify SuperUser activities cannot be viewed

steps.action: Filter users by Superusers using Show dropdown
steps.expected: SuperUser is listed but User Activity icon should not be visible
steps.actual: SuperUser Account (host) displayed with only Account Settings and Profile Settings icons - User Activity icon is NOT present, confirming SuperUser activities cannot be viewed

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View activity details for user with no activities

steps.action: View User Activity for Test User05 who has minimal activity
steps.expected: Activity panel displays with zero/minimal values for metrics
steps.actual: Activity panel displays: Engagement: 0, Influence: 0, Total Contributions: 0, Recent Activity shows only 'Joined Site 2 weeks ago' - handles users with minimal activity correctly

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Edit Points button is present

steps.action: View User Activity panel and check for Edit Points option
steps.expected: Edit Points link/button should be visible
steps.actual: EDIT POINTS link is displayed below the Rank/Reputation/Experience metrics

steps.action: View Recent Activity section in User Activity panel
steps.expected: Recent Activity section displays with activity entries
steps.actual: Recent Activity section displays with entry: 'Joined Site 2 weeks ago EVOQ CONTENT LIBRARY' - shows activity with timestamp and module name

observations: The User Activity icon is correctly hidden for SuperUsers, preventing viewing of SuperUser activities
All test users have the same 'Joined Site' activity indicating they were recently created for testing
Engagement and Influence values are 0 for all test users, possibly because no social engagement features have been used
The Edit Points feature is available, allowing administrators to modify user reputation and experience points
Error handling for non-existent users cannot be tested via UI as the user list only shows existing users - this would require API-level testing
